name: HD 200964
scenarioDescription:
The HD 200964 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 200964 is a star with 1.39 times the mass of the Sun, and 4.92 times its radius. It is located 237.25 light years away from the solar system.

HD 200964 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 200964 system


HD 200964 b

HD 200964 b was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.56 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 200964 b is 508.48199999999997 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 200964 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 200964 c

HD 200964 c was discovered by the Lick Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.96 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 200964 c is 386.05199999999996 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 200964 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 200964, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Lick Observatory.
